trans-unit.source: Sensors let your app know the relationship between a device and the physical world around it.
trans-unit.target: Sensors let your app know the relationship between a device and the physical world around it.

trans-unit.source: Sensors can tell your app the direction, orientation, and movement of the device.
trans-unit.target: Sensors can tell your app the direction, orientation, and movement of the device.

trans-unit.source: These sensors can help make your game, augmented reality app, or utility app more useful and interactive by providing a unique form of input, such as using the motion of the device to arrange the characters on the screen or to simulate being in a cockpit and using the device as the steering wheel.
trans-unit.target: These sensors can help make your game, augmented reality app, or utility app more useful and interactive by providing a unique form of input, such as using the motion of the device to arrange the characters on the screen or to simulate being in a cockpit and using the device as the steering wheel.

trans-unit.source: As a general rule, decide from the outset whether your app will depend exclusively on sensors or if sensors will just offer an additional control mechanism.
trans-unit.target: As a general rule, decide from the outset whether your app will depend exclusively on sensors or if sensors will just offer an additional control mechanism.

trans-unit.source: For example, a driving game using a device as a virtual steering wheel could alternatively be controlled through an on-screen GUI – this way, the app works regardless of the sensors available on the system.
trans-unit.target: For example, a driving game using a device as a virtual steering wheel could alternatively be controlled through an on-screen GUI – this way, the app works regardless of the sensors available on the system.

trans-unit.source: On the other hand, a marble tilt maze could be coded to only work on systems that have the appropriate sensors.
trans-unit.target: On the other hand, a marble tilt maze could be coded to only work on systems that have the appropriate sensors.

trans-unit.source: You must make the strategic choice of whether to fully rely on sensors.
trans-unit.target: You must make the strategic choice of whether to fully rely on sensors.

trans-unit.source: Note that a mouse/touch control scheme trades immersion for greater control.
trans-unit.target: Note that a mouse/touch control scheme trades immersion for greater control.

trans-unit.source: Sensor batching
trans-unit.target: Sensor batching

trans-unit.source: Some sensors support the concept of batching.
trans-unit.target: Some sensors support the concept of batching.

trans-unit.source: This will vary depending on the individual sensor available.
trans-unit.target: This will vary depending on the individual sensor available.

trans-unit.source: When a sensor implements batching, it collects several points of data over a specified time interval and then transfers all of that data at one time.
trans-unit.target: When a sensor implements batching, it collects several points of data over a specified time interval and then transfers all of that data at one time.

trans-unit.source: This is different from normal behavior where a sensor reports its findings as soon as it performs a reading.
trans-unit.target: This is different from normal behavior where a sensor reports its findings as soon as it performs a reading.

trans-unit.source: Consider the following diagram which shows how data is collected and then delivered, first with normal delivery and then with batched delivery.
trans-unit.target: Consider the following diagram which shows how data is collected and then delivered, first with normal delivery and then with batched delivery.

trans-unit.source: Sensor batch collection
trans-unit.target: Sensor batch collection

trans-unit.source: The primary advantage for sensor batching is prolonging battery life.
trans-unit.target: The primary advantage for sensor batching is prolonging battery life.

trans-unit.source: When the data is not sent immediately, that saves on processor power and prevents the data from needing to be immediately processed.
trans-unit.target: When the data is not sent immediately, that saves on processor power and prevents the data from needing to be immediately processed.

trans-unit.source: Parts of the system can sleep until they are needed, which generates a significant power savings.
trans-unit.target: Parts of the system can sleep until they are needed, which generates a significant power savings.

trans-unit.source: You can influence how often the sensor sends batches by adjusting the latency.
trans-unit.target: You can influence how often the sensor sends batches by adjusting the latency.

trans-unit.source: For example, the [**Accelerometer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225687) sensor has the [**ReportLatency**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.sensors.accelerometer.reportlatency) property.
trans-unit.target: For example, the [**Accelerometer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225687) sensor has the [**ReportLatency**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.sensors.accelerometer.reportlatency) property.

trans-unit.source: When this property is set for an application, the sensor will send data after the specified amount of time.
trans-unit.target: When this property is set for an application, the sensor will send data after the specified amount of time.

trans-unit.source: You can control how much data is accumulated over a given latency by setting the [**ReportInterval**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.sensors.accelerometer.reportinterval) property.
trans-unit.target: You can control how much data is accumulated over a given latency by setting the [**ReportInterval**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.sensors.accelerometer.reportinterval) property.

trans-unit.source: There are a couple of caveats to keep in mind with respect to setting the latency.
trans-unit.target: There are a couple of caveats to keep in mind with respect to setting the latency.

trans-unit.source: The first caveat is that each sensor has a [**MaxBatchSize**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.sensors.accelerometer.maxbatchsize.aspx) that it can support based on the sensor itself.
trans-unit.target: The first caveat is that each sensor has a [**MaxBatchSize**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.sensors.accelerometer.maxbatchsize.aspx) that it can support based on the sensor itself.

trans-unit.source: This is the number of events that the sensor can cache before it is forced to send them.
trans-unit.target: This is the number of events that the sensor can cache before it is forced to send them.

trans-unit.source: If you multiply **MaxBatchSize** by [**ReportInterval**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.sensors.accelerometer.reportinterval), that determines the maximum [**ReportLatency**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.sensors.accelerometer.reportlatency) value.
trans-unit.target: If you multiply **MaxBatchSize** by [**ReportInterval**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.sensors.accelerometer.reportinterval), that determines the maximum [**ReportLatency**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.sensors.accelerometer.reportlatency) value.

trans-unit.source: If you specify a higher value than this, the maximum latency will be used so that you do not lose data.
trans-unit.target: If you specify a higher value than this, the maximum latency will be used so that you do not lose data.

trans-unit.source: In addition, multiple applications can each set a desired latency.
trans-unit.target: In addition, multiple applications can each set a desired latency.

trans-unit.source: In order to meet the needs of all applications, the shortest latency period will be used.
trans-unit.target: In order to meet the needs of all applications, the shortest latency period will be used.

trans-unit.source: Because of these facts, the latency you set in your application may not match the observed latency.
trans-unit.target: Because of these facts, the latency you set in your application may not match the observed latency.

trans-unit.source: If a sensor is using batch reporting, calling [**GetCurrentReading**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.sensors.accelerometer.getcurrentreading) will clear the current batch of data and start a new latency period.
trans-unit.target: If a sensor is using batch reporting, calling [**GetCurrentReading**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.sensors.accelerometer.getcurrentreading) will clear the current batch of data and start a new latency period.

trans-unit.source: Accelerometer
trans-unit.target: Accelerometer

trans-unit.source: The [**Accelerometer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225687) sensor measures G-force values along the X, Y, and Z axes of the device and is great for simple motion-based applications.
trans-unit.target: The [**Accelerometer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225687) sensor measures G-force values along the X, Y, and Z axes of the device and is great for simple motion-based applications.

trans-unit.source: Note that G-force values include acceleration due to gravity.
trans-unit.target: Note that G-force values include acceleration due to gravity.

trans-unit.source: If the device has the [**SimpleOrientation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR206399) of **FaceUp** on a table, then the accelerometer would read -1 G on the Z axis.
trans-unit.target: If the device has the [**SimpleOrientation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR206399) of **FaceUp** on a table, then the accelerometer would read -1 G on the Z axis.

trans-unit.source: Thus, accelerometers do not necessarily measure just coordinate acceleration – the rate of change of velocity.
trans-unit.target: Thus, accelerometers do not necessarily measure just coordinate acceleration – the rate of change of velocity.

trans-unit.source: When using an accelerometer, make sure to differentiate between the gravitational vector from gravity and the linear acceleration vector from motion.
trans-unit.target: When using an accelerometer, make sure to differentiate between the gravitational vector from gravity and the linear acceleration vector from motion.

trans-unit.source: Note that the gravitational vector should normalize to 1 for a stationary device.
trans-unit.target: Note that the gravitational vector should normalize to 1 for a stationary device.

trans-unit.source: Apps that might use the accelerometer sensor include a game where a marble on the screen rolls in the direction you tilt the device (gravitational vector).
trans-unit.target: Apps that might use the accelerometer sensor include a game where a marble on the screen rolls in the direction you tilt the device (gravitational vector).

trans-unit.source: This type of functionality closely mirrors that of the [**Inclinometer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225766) and could also be done with that sensor by using a combination of pitch and roll.
trans-unit.target: This type of functionality closely mirrors that of the [**Inclinometer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225766) and could also be done with that sensor by using a combination of pitch and roll.

trans-unit.target: Using the accelerometer’s gravity vector simplifies this somewhat by providing an easily mathematically manipulated vector for device tilt.

trans-unit.source: Another example would be an app that makes a whip’s cracking sound when the user flicks the device through the air (linear acceleration vector).

trans-unit.source: Compass
trans-unit.target: Compass

trans-unit.source: The [**Compass**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225705) sensor returns a 2D heading with respect to magnetic north based on the horizontal plane of the earth.
trans-unit.target: The [**Compass**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225705) sensor returns a 2D heading with respect to magnetic north based on the horizontal plane of the earth.

trans-unit.source: The compass sensor should not be used in determining specific device orientation or for representing anything in 3D space.
trans-unit.target: The compass sensor should not be used in determining specific device orientation or for representing anything in 3D space.

trans-unit.source: Geographical features can cause natural declination in the heading, so some systems support both [**HeadingMagneticNorth**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225705reading_headingmagneticnorth) and [**HeadingTrueNorth**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225705reading_headingtruenorth).
trans-unit.target: Geographical features can cause natural declination in the heading, so some systems support both [**HeadingMagneticNorth**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225705reading_headingmagneticnorth) and [**HeadingTrueNorth**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225705reading_headingtruenorth).

trans-unit.source: Think about which one your app prefers, but remember that not all systems will report a true north value.
trans-unit.target: Think about which one your app prefers, but remember that not all systems will report a true north value.

trans-unit.source: The gyrometer and magnetometer (a device measuring magnetic strength magnitude) sensors combine their data to produce the compass heading, which has the net effect of stabilizing the data (magnetic field strength is very unstable due to electrical system components).
trans-unit.target: The gyrometer and magnetometer (a device measuring magnetic strength magnitude) sensors combine their data to produce the compass heading, which has the net effect of stabilizing the data (magnetic field strength is very unstable due to electrical system components).

trans-unit.source: Compass readings in regards to Magnetic North Pole
trans-unit.target: Compass readings in regards to Magnetic North Pole

trans-unit.source: Apps that want to display a compass rose or navigate a map would typically use the compass sensor.
trans-unit.target: Apps that want to display a compass rose or navigate a map would typically use the compass sensor.

trans-unit.source: Gyrometer
trans-unit.target: Gyrometer

trans-unit.source: The [**Gyrometer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225718) sensor measures angular velocities along the X, Y, and Z axes.
trans-unit.target: The [**Gyrometer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225718) sensor measures angular velocities along the X, Y, and Z axes.

trans-unit.source: These are very useful in simple motion-based apps that do not concern themselves with device orientation but care about the device rotating at different speeds.
trans-unit.target: These are very useful in simple motion-based apps that do not concern themselves with device orientation but care about the device rotating at different speeds.

trans-unit.source: Gyrometers can suffer from noise in the data or a constant bias along one or more of the axes.
trans-unit.target: Gyrometers can suffer from noise in the data or a constant bias along one or more of the axes.

trans-unit.source: You should query the accelerometer to verify whether the device is moving in order to determine if the gyrometer suffers from a bias, and then compensate accordingly in your app.
trans-unit.target: You should query the accelerometer to verify whether the device is moving in order to determine if the gyrometer suffers from a bias, and then compensate accordingly in your app.

trans-unit.source: Gyrometer with pitch, roll, and yaw
trans-unit.target: Gyrometer with pitch, roll, and yaw

trans-unit.source: An example of an app that could use the gyrometer sensor is a game that spins a roulette wheel based on a quick rotational jerk of the device.
trans-unit.target: An example of an app that could use the gyrometer sensor is a game that spins a roulette wheel based on a quick rotational jerk of the device.

trans-unit.source: Inclinometer
trans-unit.target: Inclinometer

trans-unit.source: The [**Inclinometer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225766) sensor specifies the yaw, pitch, and roll values of a device and work best with apps that care about how the device is situated in space.
trans-unit.target: The [**Inclinometer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225766) sensor specifies the yaw, pitch, and roll values of a device and work best with apps that care about how the device is situated in space.

trans-unit.source: Pitch and roll are derived by taking the accelerometer’s gravity vector and by integrating the data from the gyrometer.
trans-unit.target: Pitch and roll are derived by taking the accelerometer’s gravity vector and by integrating the data from the gyrometer.

trans-unit.source: Yaw is established from magnetometer and gyrometer (similar to compass heading) data.
trans-unit.target: Yaw is established from magnetometer and gyrometer (similar to compass heading) data.

trans-unit.source: Inclinometers offer advanced orientation data in an easily digestible and understandable way.
trans-unit.target: Inclinometers offer advanced orientation data in an easily digestible and understandable way.

trans-unit.source: Use inclinometers when you need device orientation but do not need to manipulate the sensor data.
trans-unit.target: Use inclinometers when you need device orientation but do not need to manipulate the sensor data.

trans-unit.source: Inclinometer with pitch, roll and yaw data
trans-unit.target: Inclinometer with pitch, roll and yaw data

trans-unit.source: Apps that change their view to match the orientation of the device can use the inclinometer sensor.
trans-unit.target: Apps that change their view to match the orientation of the device can use the inclinometer sensor.

trans-unit.source: Also, an app that displays an airplane that matches the yaw, pitch, and roll of the device would also use the inclinometer readings.
trans-unit.target: Also, an app that displays an airplane that matches the yaw, pitch, and roll of the device would also use the inclinometer readings.

trans-unit.target: Light sensor

trans-unit.target: The [**Light**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225790) sensor is capable of determining the ambient light surrounding the sensor.

trans-unit.target: This enables an app to determine when the light setting surrounding a device has changed.

trans-unit.target: For example, a user with a slate device might walk from indoors to outdoors on a sunny day.

trans-unit.source: A smart application could use this value to increase the contrast between the background and the font being rendered.

trans-unit.source: Orientation sensor
trans-unit.target: Orientation sensor

trans-unit.source: Device orientation is expressed through both quaternion and a rotation matrix.
trans-unit.target: Device orientation is expressed through both quaternion and a rotation matrix.

trans-unit.source: The [**OrientationSensor**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR206371) offers a high degree of precision in determining how the device is situated in space with respect to absolute heading.
trans-unit.target: The [**OrientationSensor**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR206371) offers a high degree of precision in determining how the device is situated in space with respect to absolute heading.

trans-unit.source: The **OrientationSensor** data is derived from the accelerometer, gyrometer, and magnetometer.
trans-unit.target: The **OrientationSensor** data is derived from the accelerometer, gyrometer, and magnetometer.

trans-unit.source: As such, both the inclinometer and compass sensors can be derived from the quaternion values.
trans-unit.target: As such, both the inclinometer and compass sensors can be derived from the quaternion values.

trans-unit.source: Quaternions and rotation matrices lend themselves well to advanced mathematical manipulation and are often used in graphical programming.
trans-unit.target: Quaternions and rotation matrices lend themselves well to advanced mathematical manipulation and are often used in graphical programming.

trans-unit.source: Apps using complex manipulation should favor the orientation sensor as many transforms are based off of quaternions and rotation matrices.
trans-unit.target: Apps using complex manipulation should favor the orientation sensor as many transforms are based off of quaternions and rotation matrices.

trans-unit.source: Several fitness applications like to keep track of the number of steps taken in order to help the user set and reach various goals.
trans-unit.target: Several fitness applications like to keep track of the number of steps taken in order to help the user set and reach various goals.

trans-unit.source: Proximity sensor
trans-unit.target: Proximity sensor

trans-unit.source: The [**Proximity**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn872427) sensor can be used to indicate whether or not objects are detected by the sensor.
trans-unit.target: The [**Proximity**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn872427) sensor can be used to indicate whether or not objects are detected by the sensor.

trans-unit.source: In addition to determining whether or not an object is within range of the device, the proximity sensor also can determine the distance to the detected object.
trans-unit.target: In addition to determining whether or not an object is within range of the device, the proximity sensor also can determine the distance to the detected object.

trans-unit.source: One example where this could be used is with an application that wants to emerge from a sleep state when a user comes within a specified range.
